intro: Chaetocarpus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cariophyllaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, often violet or blue flowers. Chaetocarpus species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions. Their botanical features make them valuable for ecological restoration projects in coastal regions.
